verb.description: Cause (two or more things) to change places with each other.
examples: the captions describing the two state flowers were accidentally transposed

verb.description: Transfer to a different place or context.
examples: the problems of civilization are transposed into a rustic setting

noun.description: A matrix obtained from a given matrix by interchanging each row and the corresponding column.

origin: Late Middle English (also in the sense transform, convert): from Old French transposer, from trans- across + poser to place.
